jsymbolic2.featureutils

Class FeatureExtractorAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsymbolic2.featureutils.FeatureExtractorAccess

  • public final class FeatureExtractorAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class collects all implemented MIDIFeatureExtractor classes (including MEIFeatureExtractor extractors), orders them to match the specifications of the jSymbolic manual, and indicates which ones are set to be extracted and saved by default. This allows for consistent access to implemented features, regardless of whether the jSymbolic GUI, command line interface, API of configuration file is being used.

    IMPORTANT:All newly implemented MIDIFeatureExtractor objects must be referenced in the all_implemented_feature_extractors and default_features_to_save fields of this class. Automatic error checking is performed on all_implemented_feature_extractors and default_features_to_save at instantiation, and potential problems are printed to standard error.

    Author:
    Cory McKay and Tristano Tenaglia

    • Constructor Detail

      • FeatureExtractorAccess

        public FeatureExtractorAccess()

    • Method Detail

      • getAllImplementedFeatureExtractors

        public static MIDIFeatureExtractor[] getAllImplementedFeatureExtractors()
        Returns:
        An array consisting of one instantiated MIDIFeatureExtractor object for each implemented feature extractor (including MEIFeatureExtractor features). These are ordered in the same order in which they are presented in the jSymbolic manual.

      • getDefaultFeaturesToSave

        public static boolean[] getDefaultFeaturesToSave()
        Returns:
        An array with one entry for every feature implemented as a MIDIFeatureExtractor (including MEIFeatureExtractor features). These are ordered in the same order in which they are presented in the jSymbolic manual. Each entry is set to true if that feature is to be extracted and saved by default, and to false if is not.

      • getNamesOfAllImplementedFeatures

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNamesOfAllImplementedFeatures()
        Returns:
        A List consisting of the feature names of every feature implemented as a MIDIFeatureExtractor (including MEIFeatureExtractor features). These are ordered in the same order in which they are presented in the jSymbolic manual.

      • getNamesOfDefaultFeaturesToSave

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNamesOfDefaultFeaturesToSave()
        Returns:
        A List consisting of the feature names of every feature implemented as a MIDIFeatureExtractor (including MEIFeatureExtractor features) and that has also been chosen to be saved by default. These are ordered in the same order in which they are presented in the jSymbolic manual.

      • getNamesOfMeiSpecificFeatures

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNamesOfMeiSpecificFeatures()
        Returns:
        A List consisting of the feature names of every feature implemented as an MEIFeatureExtractor. These are ordered in the same order in which they are presented in the jSymbolic manual.

      • getNamesOfFeaturesToExtract

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNamesOfFeaturesToExtract(boolean[] features_to_extract)
        Given a list of which features should be extracted, return the names of those features that are set to be extracted by this list.
        Parameters:
        features_to_extract - Which features should be extracted. This must correspond in size to the total number of features implemented, and must be ordered in the same order in which they are presented in the jSymbolic manual.
        Returns:
        The names of the features to extract.

      • findSpecifiedFeatures

        public static boolean[] findSpecifiedFeatures(java.util.List<java.lang.String> chosen_feature_names)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Take the specified list of feature names and return a boolean array indicating which amongst all the features jSymbolic can extract have their names included in the specified list.
        Parameters:
        chosen_feature_names - A list of names of features that should be marked as true in the returned array.
        Returns:
        An array sized to match the complete list of features that jSymbolic can extract, in the order that they are specified in the manual. A given entry is set to true if the name of the corresponding feature is contained in chosen_feature_names, and to false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An informative Exception is thrown if one of the feature names in chosen_feature_names does not correspond to the name of an implemented feature.

      • getFeatureCatalogueOverviewReport

        public static java.lang.String getFeatureCatalogueOverviewReport(boolean[] features_to_include)
        Prepare a formatted report outlining statistics about the breakdown of all features, as well as of only those features selected as defaults.
        Parameters:
        features_to_include - An array corresponding in size and order to the contents of the all_implemented_feature_extractors field of this class. Values of true indicate that that feature should be included in this report, and false indicate that it should not. If this is null, then a report is generated for all implemented features.
        Returns:
        The formatted report.
